definition[0]: to wish that you had someone else’s possessions, abilities etc
example[0]: I really envy you and Ian, you seem so happy together.
example[1]: She has a lifestyle which most people would envy.
example[2]: He envied Rosalind her youth and strength.
definition[1]: the feeling of wanting something that someone else has
example[3]: She could see that all the other girls were green with envy  (=feeling a lot of envy).
example[4]: I felt a twinge of envy when I saw them together.
example[5]: He watched the others with envy.
example[6]: his envy of the young man’s success
